Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a Redis Sentinel connection provider class in Java that manages connections to a Redis master node through Sentinel monitoring, including automatic failover handling.

Class Description: SentineledConnectionProvider is a class that provides managed connections to a Redis master node in a Sentinel-monitored environment. It automatically discovers the current master through Sentinel nodes and maintains a connection pool to it. The class also includes a listener thread that monitors for master failover events and updates the connection pool accordingly.

Attributes:
- currentMaster: [HostAndPort] - The current master node's host and port
- pool: [ConnectionPool] - The connection pool to the current master node
- masterName: [String] - The name of the Redis master as configured in Sentinel
- masterClientConfig: [JedisClientConfig] - Configuration for connections to the master node
- sentinelClientConfig: [JedisClientConfig] - Configuration for connections to Sentinel nodes

Methods:
- SentineledConnectionProvider([String] masterName, [JedisClientConfig] masterClientConfig, [Set<HostAndPort>] sentinels, [JedisClientConfig] sentinelClientConfig) -> [void] - Constructor that initializes the connection provider with master name, configurations, and Sentinel nodes
- getConnection() -> [Connection] - Retrieves a connection from the pool to the current master node
- initMaster([HostAndPort] master) -> [void] - Initializes or updates the connection pool to the specified master node
- initSentinels([Set<HostAndPort>] sentinels) -> [HostAndPort] - Discovers the current master node through Sentinel nodes
- SentinelListener([HostAndPort] node) -> [void] - Nested class constructor for Sentinel listener thread
- run() -> [void] - Main execution method of the Sentinel listener thread (overrides Thread.run())
- shutdown() -> [void] - Shuts down the Sentinel listener thread
